Finding A: Again, the interaction of volitional self-efficacy and smoking-specific received social support was significant (p< .05, see Figure 2 ).
Finding B: Kids with ADHD have brains that lag in maturation.

Finding A: Again, the interaction of volitional self-efficacy and smoking-specific received social support was significant (p< .05, see Figure 2 ).
Finding B: Kids with ADHD have brains that lag in maturation.

Psychology_105_p$Psychology_193_r$Psycho.text:
Finding A: We found significant and specific maturational lag in connections within default mode network (DMN) and in DMN interconnections with two task positive networks (TPNs): frontoparietal network and ventral attention network.
Finding B: The researchers found functional connectivity between the areas of the brain associated with short-term memory, self, and negative emotions, which cause sufferers to dwell on bad thoughts and lead to a poor quality of sleep.
Finding C: "Pretreatment with CBD significantly reduced anxiety, cognitive impairment and discomfort in their speech...
Finding D: Longitudinal results, however, supported the study\'s central hypothesis: Early adolescent pseudomature behavior predicted long-term difficulties in close relationships, as well as significant problems with alcohol and substance use, and elevated levels of criminal behavior.

Finding A: We found significant and specific maturational lag in connections within default mode network (DMN) and in DMN interconnections with two task positive networks (TPNs): frontoparietal network and ventral attention network.
Finding B: The researchers found functional connectivity between the areas of the brain associated with short-term memory, self, and negative emotions, which cause sufferers to dwell on bad thoughts and lead to a poor quality of sleep.
Finding C: "Pretreatment with CBD significantly reduced anxiety, cognitive impairment and discomfort in their speech...
Finding D: Longitudinal results, however, supported the study\'s central hypothesis: Early adolescent pseudomature behavior predicted long-term difficulties in close relationships, as well as significant problems with alcohol and substance use, and elevated levels of criminal behavior.

Psychology_tweet_144_p$Psychology_147_p$.text:
Finding A: In contrast, there was on average no change in perceived pleasure from smoking cigarettes when using marijuana (5.3 ± 2.7, t (199) ¼ 1.7, p ¼ .09).
Finding B: The results from study 1 provide support for the hypothesis that behaviorally targeted advertisements can act as implied social labels, resulting in adjustments to behavior consistent with the label.
Finding C: Despite romantic relationships being relatively new in adolescence, the better teens were at establishing autonomy and relatedness with partners at age 18, the better they were at establishing autonomy and relatedness with both friends and partners at age 21.
Finding D: We therefore predict that when the label implied by a behaviorally targeted advertisement is plausibly connected to the consumer\'s prior behavior (i.e., the targeting is at least moderately accurate), consumers perceive that the marketer has labeled them correctly and respond accordingly, altering their self-perceptions and hence behavior to be consistent with the identity implied by the ad.
Psychology_tweet_144_p$Psychology_147_p$.displayed_text:
Finding A: In contrast, there was on average no change in perceived pleasure from smoking cigarettes when using marijuana (5.3 ± 2.7, t (199) ¼ 1.7, p ¼ .09).
Finding B: The results from study 1 provide support for the hypothesis that behaviorally targeted advertisements can act as implied social labels, resulting in adjustments to behavior consistent with the label.
Finding C: Despite romantic relationships being relatively new in adolescence, the better teens were at establishing autonomy and relatedness with partners at age 18, the better they were at establishing autonomy and relatedness with both friends and partners at age 21.
Finding D: We therefore predict that when the label implied by a behaviorally targeted advertisement is plausibly connected to the consumer\'s prior behavior (i.e., the targeting is at least moderately accurate), consumers perceive that the marketer has labeled them correctly and respond accordingly, altering their self-perceptions and hence behavior to be consistent with the identity implied by the ad.

Psychology_16_p$Psychology_17_r$Psycholo.text:
Finding A: These findings provides a neural basis for understanding how depression is associated with poor sleep quality, and this in turn has implications for treatment because of the brain areas identified.
Finding B: The researchers also made the observation of an increased risk of hyperactivity disorder among circumcised boys in non-Muslim families.
Finding C: Our study confirms and extends findings from previous longitudinal studies of post-infective fatigue syndrome, which have observed greater fatigue at initial presentation to clinics, around four weeks post-infection, in those who would go on to experience persistent fatigue VollmerConna et al., 2007) .
Finding D: #Stroke survivors can have “significant” improvement in arm movements after using interactive video games

Psychology_tweet_21_r$Psychology_434_r$P.text:
Finding A: Here’s our latest on psychotic experiences (PE) &suicide. Big pic: PE are clinically important! They predict ⬆️⬆️⬆️ risk of attempted &completed suicide (beyond what’s explained by co-occurring mental illness). #SystematicReview @username
Finding B: Of the 95 participants with ASD, 78 per cent reported at least one occurrence of sexual victimization compared to 47.4 per cent of the 117 adults without ASD who participated in the study.
Finding C: Feeling of spiritual well-being significantly increased across all participants (P < .001).
Finding D: Third, with the existence of these strengths-based interventions, social services providers can develop a program of services that support black gay and bisexual men's HIV-negativity maintenance.

Finding B: Of the 95 participants with ASD, 78 per cent reported at least one occurrence of sexual victimization compared to 47.4 per cent of the 117 adults without ASD who participated in the study.
Finding C: Feeling of spiritual well-being significantly increased across all participants (P < .001).
Finding D: Third, with the existence of these strengths-based interventions, social services providers can develop a program of services that support black gay and bisexual men's HIV-negativity maintenance.

Psychology_tweet_136_p$Psychology_tweet_.text:
Finding A: We argue that the more beautiful music is, the easier it is for the listener to concentrate on the music.
Finding B: Touch could help us feel the pain of others, study. I wonder if this works to tell real pain vs faked pain.
Finding C: The result was that all participants rated the four odours more positively when they were presented with positive labels than when presented with negative labels.
Finding D: Change in memory accuracy also did not differ when tested after a nap compared to the change in memory accuracy after an interval awake, they report.

Psychology_305_r$Psychology_16_r$Psychol.text:
Finding A: Future studies of brain network maturation in ADHD could shed light into the neural basis for this difference.
Finding B: The researchers conclude that increased functional connectivity among these brain regions provides a neural basis for how depression is related to poor sleep quality.
Finding C: "Marijuana abusers show lower positive and higher negative emotionality scores than controls, which is consistent, on one hand, with lower reward sensitivity and motivation and, on the other hand, with increased stress reactivity and irritability," researchers wrote in the study.
Finding D: Overall, our findings lend support for autonomy support as a leadership approach that is consistent with self-determination and optimal functioning in work settings.

Finding C: "Marijuana abusers show lower positive and higher negative emotionality scores than controls, which is consistent, on one hand, with lower reward sensitivity and motivation and, on the other hand, with increased stress reactivity and irritability," researchers wrote in the study.
Finding D: Overall, our findings lend support for autonomy support as a leadership approach that is consistent with self-determination and optimal functioning in work settings.
